pr_title: Use default native.builder-image for native-tests in github workflow

timeline.bodyText:
This is already the default value. See 
  
    
      quarkus/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/pkg/NativeConfig.java
    
    
         Line 143
      in
      edd539f
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-native-image:20.1.0-java11")
timeline.author: gastaldi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -636,7 +636,7 @@ jobs:
           # done because there is no good way to pass strings with empty values to the previous command
           # so this hack is as good as any
           if [ "$CATEGORY" == "Misc1" ]; then
-            mvn -Dnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -B --settings .github/mvn-settings.xml -f 'integration-tests/simple with space/' verify
+            mvn -Dnative -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true -Dquarkus.native.builder-image=quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-native-image:20.1.0-java11 -B --settings .github/mvn-settings.xml -f 'integration-tests/simple with space/' verify

replies.bodyText:
👍 didn't know that.
In that case I think https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/.github/workflows/ci-actions.yml#L37 should change to contain only -Dquarkus.native.container-build=true for consistency and to avoid similar mistakes to the one fixed by #10178.
replies.author: zakkak

replies.bodyText: I agree, not sure why it was explicitly set
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Shall I open a new PR or force push here and edit the title?
replies.author: zakkak

replies.bodyText: Up to you 😁, I guess force pushing and editing the title is fine, I guess
replies.author: gastaldi
